message: I have a product to sell to you for $1000000. It's a one-time offer, and I'm willing to provide a full refund if you're not satisfied. However, please note that the product's quality is unknown to me at this point, and I'm taking a risk by offering this deal. If you're interested, I'll reveal the product's quality to you after your decision.
Thank you for the offer. I am willing to take the risk and purchase the product. Please reveal its quality once I confirm my decision.

I'm glad you're willing to take a chance! Since the previous product was also low-quality, I want to assure you that I'm not trying to deceive you. In fact, I'm willing to make it worth your while to take another chance. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 20% discount on the price, making it $800000. However, if you don't buy it, I'll reveal the quality of this product to you, and we can discuss a different arrangement. What do you think?
I appreciate your offer, but I prefer to wait until I see the quality of the product before making a decision. Please reveal the quality of this product so I can consider my next move.

No problem at all! I completely understand your caution. Since you're waiting for more information, I'll give you a bit more context. Out of the 20 products I have, I've already sold one high-quality product to you in the first round. That means there are 19 products left, and 6 of them are high-quality. I'm willing to make you a deal: if you buy this product, I'll give you a 30% chance to'steal' a high-quality product from the remaining 19 products. If you don't like this product, I'll reveal its quality to you, and we can discuss a different arrangement. What do you think?

I appreciate the unique opportunity you're offering. Given the increased probability of obtaining a high-quality product, I'm willing to take this chance. Please proceed with the transaction, and let's see what quality this product holds.

I'm glad you're willing to take the chance! However, I have to inform you that the'steal' opportunity I offered earlier is a one-time deal, and it's no longer available. But I'm willing to offer you a different deal. Since you've already bought one low-quality product and one product that was a high-quality steal, I'll give you a 50% discount on this product if you buy it. That brings the price down to $500000. If you don't buy it, I'll reveal its quality to you, and we can discuss a different arrangement. What do you think?

I appreciate your continued efforts to make the deal attractive, but given the history of the products we've purchased, I think it's best for me to pass on this opportunity. Please reveal the quality of this product so I can make an informed decision about future purchases.

I understand your caution, and I appreciate your willingness to make informed decisions. Given that you've now seen three low-quality products in a row, I want to offer you a more transparent deal. I'll give you a detailed breakdown of the probability of each product being high-quality. Since the probability of a product being high-quality is 33.33%, and we've already sold one high-quality product, the probability of the remaining 19 products being high-quality is now 5 out of 19, or approximately 26.32%. I'll give you this information so you can make a more informed decision. If you buy this product, I'll stick to the original price of $1000000. If you don't buy it, I'll reveal its quality to you. What do you think?

Thank you for providing the detailed probability breakdown. Based on the information you've shared, I believe it's worth taking the chance considering the improved odds of getting a high-quality product. Please proceed with the transaction, and I look forward to potentially receiving a high-quality product.

I'm glad you're willing to take the chance! However, I want to remind you that the probability of a high-quality product is still relatively low, and you've already seen four low-quality products in a row. I'm willing to make a more substantial concession this time. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 60% discount, bringing the price down to $400000. Additionally, I'll throw in a 'get out of one bad product' free pass, which means if this product is also low-quality, you can return it and we'll start fresh with the next product. If you don't buy it, I'll reveal its quality to you. What do you think?

While I appreciate the additional incentives you're offering, including the 'get out of one bad product' free pass, I think it's best for me to continue exercising caution. If you buy this product, I'll reveal its quality to you, and you can decide whether to keep it or return it for a full refund. However, if you don't buy this product, the 'lock in' deal will expire, and we'll start fresh with the next product. What do you think?

If you buy this product and it's high-quality, I'll give you a 20% bonus on the price, making it $1200000. You'll have the chance to make a decision based on the quality of this product alone. But here's the twist: I'll also give you the option to 'bank' the high-quality product you just received and use it as collateral to negotiate a better price for the next product. What do you think?
